lines.text: What do you do when your foundation falls apart? I don't know. They don't teach you that in school.
Only posers die you fucking idiot!
Wait, time out. I just wanted to ask real quick, if I can. You believe in rebellion, freedom and love, right?
Absolutely, yes.
Rebellion, freedom, love.

You move from New York City, the Mecca and hub of the cultural world to Utah! Nowhere! To change nothing! More to perpetuate this cycle of greed, fascism and triviality. Your movement of the people, by and for the people got you... nothing! You just hide behind some lost sense of drugs, sex and rock and roll. Ooooh, Kumbaya! I am the future! I am the future of this great nation which you, father, so arrogantly saved this world for. Look, I have my own agenda. Harvard, out. University of Utah, in. I'm gonna get a 4.0 in damage. I love you guys! Don't get me wrong, it's all about this. But for the first time in my life, I'm 18 and I can say "FUUUUUCK YOU!"
Steven, I didn't sell out son. I bought in. Keep that in mind. That kid's gonna make a hell of a lawyer, huh?
Yeah, he takes after his father. He's a son of a bitch.
Well fuck you dear.
Well, it's a crazy fucked up world and we're all just floating along waiting for someone who can walk on water, man.
I guess when all was said and done, I was nothing more than a God-damned, trendy-ass poser.
Can I help you?
Yeah, I called about the job.
You called?
Yeah, I wanna sell clothes, women's clothes.
I don't know. Have you ever had experience?
With what?
Women's clothes?
What the fuck would I be doing with women's clothes? What do I look like a transvestite? I'm not no fucking transvestite, all right?
No, no, no, I mean, have you ever worked in retail?
Huh?
You know, selling... clothess

Well if I was selling clothes already, what would I be doing here? I really don't think this is the right way to start a working relationship. You got a real, a real bad attitude, lady. In fact I don't even wan't you job, I don't care how much you'd pay me, cause I got integrity, in-fucking-tegrity. WAAAH.

Posers were people who looked like punks but they did it for fashion. And they were fools, they'd say "anarchy in the UK." What the fuck's that? Anarchy in the UK. What good is that to those of us in Utah, America? It was a Sex Pistols thing. They were British, they were allowed to go on about Anarchy in the UK. You don't live your life by lyrics.
Do you love her?
I don't know. I'd have to think about that.
It's not really a thinking question.
You see life is like that. We change, that's all. You see, the guy I am now is not the guy I was then. If the guy I was then met the guy I am now he'd beat the shit out of me. Those are the facts.

I like Sandy. Now Sandy has nothing to do with anarchy in general, she's just a beautiful, wonderful, funny, witty, loving, sexy, tough-as-nails, little weird girl, and I absolutely adore her. I like Sandy a lot.

our redneck skirmishes are cheap perversions of conventional warfare. War implies extreme government because wars are fought to enforce rules or ideals, even freedom. But other people ideals forced on someone else, even if it is something like freedom, is still a rule; not anarchy. This contradiction was becoming clear to me in the fall of '85. Even as early as my first party, "Why did I love to fight?" I framed it, but still, I don't understand it. It goes against my beliefs as a true anarchist. But there it was. Competition, fighting, capitalism, government, THE SYSTEM. That's what we did. It's what we always did. Rednecks kicked the shit out of punks, punks kicked the shit out of mods, mods kicked the shit out of skinheads, skinheads took out the heavy metal guys, and the heavy metal guys beat the living shit out of new wavers and the new wavers did nothing. What was the point? Final summation? None.

Where were we going? I mean, really, what was happening? This life, it was crazy. I felt tired. I mean, halfway through the season, I just felt, inside, I was so tired. And I had this wave of melancholy just like sweep through me.
See, to me, England was nothing more then a big fucking American state like North Dakota or Canada.
[on whether punk music started in England or America]

I don't know who started it and I don't give a fuck. The one thing I do know is that we did it harder, we did it faster, and we definitely did it with more love, baby. You can't take that away from us.
The sun never sets on the British Empire... well the sun never sets on my asshole.
SINK, YOU FOOL!
You're pretty fucking weird you know that?
[handing Stevo a bag of weed]
Here you go, but be careful, that stuff'll make you stupid.
[Someone throws a beer can at Stevo]
FUCK YOU.
Well, stupider than you already are.
To be an anarchist in Salt Lake City was certainly no easy task, especially in 1985. And having no money, no job, no plans for the future, the true anarchist position was in itself a strenuous job.
I love you guys, don't get me wrong. But for the first time in my life I'm eighteen and I can say fuuuuck youuu.
nothing. How the Mormon settlers looked upon this valley and felt that it was the promised land is beyond me. I don't know, maybe it looked different back then.
It really makes you think, doesn't it, Bob?
Think what?
That chemistry's the WRONG FUCKING MAJOR FOR A GUY LIKE YOU. It's the wrong major, Bob.
Well you shoud still lay off the acid.

You know that dude Napoleon? Yeah. Uh, he was banished to an island when the French got sick of him. That's right. He supposedly died of stomach problems, right? wrong! He was actually poisoned over a long period of time. Murdered by arsenic; a preservative. And you know how?
No idea.
His hair.
His hair?
His fucking hair. It was arsenic. You could tell how long he was being poisoned by following the traces of poison up his hair. Dude, dude, dude, if you do enough hits of it you're dead!
It really makes you think, doesn't it Bob?
Think? Think what?
That chemistry's the wrong fucking major for a guy like you. It's the wrong major, Bob!
Well you should lay off the acid anyways man.
You're a Nazi!
Nazi, I'm Jewish, Steven, how can I be a Nazi?
That's the worst. Dad, look at this. What kinda, what kinda car is this?
That would be a Porshe.
A Porshe, that you bought at a Volkswagen dealership. Volkswagen, right? For the people who designed it? Who made that possible, Let me give you a hint, Adolf Hitler.
IT'S JUST A CAR!
What the hell are you?
ooo, we come from the east in search of the Messiah! We followed that big star
[points upwards]
Yeah, we bring gold, and frankincense.

[Still pointing upwards]
You see it?
and myrrh.
Myrrh.
You do what?
Followed the star.
Oh my God. Who let you boys out of the state institute? We'd better get you boys back in the hospital.
No, no, no, no, no, it's all right, man. We're from England.
England?
Yeah, that's right. That's probably why we seem so weird to you, man.
England, huh? Well that explains it I guess.
You here to visit?
Yes. I think we're all excited to see how he's doing.
Have you seen "The Exorcist"?
Yeah.
Did you like it?
Yeah. Is this dangerous?
Not clinically.
What does that mean?
I wanna save the rain forests, y'know, somebody's gotta fight for them, it's just...
[can't seem to find the right word, so he slams the table instead]
That's what's wrong with you Americans, you're always looking for pain.
Yeah well... it pains me to hear you say that, Mark, it really does.
It's like fucking Jesus Christ took a shit and it landed right here, so you can be happy all you fucking want.

There were quite a few punks in the SLC back in '85, but there were equally as many posers. Posers were kids who would dress and act like punks but they did it for fashion. They were fools! They'd say shit like...
Anarchy in the U.K.!

See what I mean? Posers. "Anarchy in the U.K." What the fuck's that? It was a Sex Pistols thing. That's where they were from, they were British! They were allowed to go on about anarchy in the U.K. but what does that mean to us in Utah, America? That's all you ever hear from these trendy fucks like
[in really bad British accent]
"Did you hear the new Smiths album? It's fuckin' terriff'!" Stupid posers walking around Utah saying "terriff'" with a stupid English twang.
[Grabs a poser with Union Jack patch]

See what I mean? What's up with the England bullshit. Union Jack is a FAG! I used to know this girl who would only have sex with a guy if he had a stupid fuckin' accent. So these assholes... and there are plenty of assholes in this general area would get her drunk and then put on some stupid fuckin' accent and go to her and say
[in really bad English accent]
"'Ello misstress! You fancy a shag?" And there she'd be, fuckin knees in the sky. It was sad, it made me sad! Girl had no self respect!

[in British accent]
'Ello, mistress. do you fancy a SHAG?

I mean, I knew a girl, right, who'd only have sex with a guy if he had a fuckin' accent. Can you think of anything more ludacris in your life? So every asshole in Salt Lake City, and let me tell ya, plenty assholes in this general region, that wanna do a little of this, would get her drunk and put on some kind of stupid fucking accent like 'Ello mistress, do you fancy a shag?' And there she would, fuckin' knees to the sky. It was sad, it made me really sad. Poor girl had no self respect.
Hey Eddie, do you like this music?
Yeah. It rocks!
Well I think this music's for posers.

[brief pause]
Well i think you're a fag.
FAG!
In a country of lost souls rebellion comes hard. But in a religiously oppressive city, where half it's population isn't even of that religion, it comes like fire.
So, you see any land around here?
Nope, just water.
Sean, what are you doin' outside man?
you're him?
...yeah... I'm him

[claps hands together]
JESUS! Have i sinned or am i goin' to heaven?

[laughing]
you're fryin' man, how much acid did you take?
you're not Jesus... you're Bob
I'm Bob!... how goes it?
how are you doin' that?
doin' what?
walkin' on water? if i get off this chair I'll drown, you wanna know what Bob? 'Cause i cant swim!
oh, i get it! so Sean, d'you see land anywhere?

[looking around]
no... just water... say Bob, You ARE Jesus.
Thats Right, I am, why do you ask?
...Satan, is in the house, he killed my Mom and turned her into a bull!
[after flashback to a scene with Sean threatening his mother with a knife but being scared by Satan and a bull, his mother]
[bob waves to Seans mum at the window who reluctantly waves back]

[the Cops pull in]
Put your hands in the air and slowly turn around!

[happy as happy can be]
I'M SAVED
yeah... sure Sean... you're saved...
I can't get off this chair or I'll drown, wanna know why, Bob? 'Cause I can't swim.
Satan is in the house. He killed my mom... and turned her into a bull.

[about the "beat the shit" out of a guy who was having sex with his female friend]
It wasn't that I loved Sandy, I knew that we had an understanding. But I discovered then that Chris was right, all things had systems, even me. I was about to beat the living shit out of this guy because he had invaded my territory. It was MY territory, no question about it, just like in the wild. I was following nature, and nature was order and order is the system.
You know that shit you guys do? You're fucking yourselves up man. Fucking acid, acid, it never leaves the body. It's in your fucking spinal cord forever.
Chemicals man, they'll fuck you up.
So Mark. how you doin' old man?
FUCK! I'm not old motherfucker.
Oh no, I just... no, I mean... you're older than anyone else here.
It depends on how you look at it. I'm young in my heart! Younger then any of these assholes over there.

[to Mark who is leaving Salt Lake City]
If you ever get lonely, if you ever need someone to talk to... Bob's here for you.
Hey Stevo.
[good naturedly]
Fuck you.
Noooo. Fuuuccckkkk yooouuuuuuu.
Now you see the problem with water beds is that they have these waves like this,
[makes motions of waves with hands]
Right? But you see this water bed is special,
[draws his hands across the bed]
, you see? It has no waves.
Why didn't you just get a normal bed... that has no waves?
[awkward silence]
But this HAS no waves.
You know what Bob? You ARE Jesus!
That's right... Why do you ask?
No, you're not Jesus, you're Bob!
I'm Bob!

[Police cars pull up to arrest Sean]
I'm saved!
Sure Sean, you're saved.
Fuck you!
No, fuck yourself. You'd get more pussy.
How about, how about we turn this off?
Don't touch my stereo, Bob.
Give it a chance, give me a chance. I got this from a guy I know in L.A.
You know a guy in L.A.?
You tell ME... this doesn't rock.
[stereo starts playing "Kiss Me Deadly"]
This isn't anything.
Just give it a chance.

[pause]
... Well, what is it?
What is it?
Yeah, what is it, Bob?
It's new.
